body:
If you are happy we can close this issue. The runtime team is aware of the
issue.

On Thu, Aug 20, 2015 at 9:23 AM, Zoltan <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @RLH <https://github.com/RLH> You were right! GOGC it is!
>
> Running the Go 1.5 compiled program with GOGC=400 makes it complete the
> task in the exact same amount of time as the previous (Go 1.4.2 compiled)
> version: 32 seconds.
>
> Just out of curiosity, I tested the program with GOGC=800 but I didn't
> gain too much: completion time went down to about 30 seconds. I'm sure
> total memory usage went a bit up too.
>
> So it seems that for my case a value of about 400, maybe 500 is the most
> optimal, speed-wise.
>
> Should we close this issue now?
